bestBHT.bht: This beloved son mentioned in the text is none other than the Messiah, the one and only Son of God, who enjoys a special filial bond with his Father. Rejoicing in the presence of his Father, he should be esteemed and honored with deep reverence.

Marvin Vincent: Therefore. The best texts omit. Last. Mark only.
John Gill: The Messiah, the Lord Jesus Christ, who is the one, and only Son of God his Father, his only begotten Son, for he has no other Son in the same way of filiation.
This Son he having with him, in his bosom, as one brought up with him, and rejoicing before him.
Saying, they will reverence my son.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse speaks of a beloved son who holds a special position of reverence. This son is none other than the Messiah, the only begotten Son of God, who rejoices in the presence of his Father and holds a unique filial relationship with him. The implication is that this beloved son is to be honored and revered.

This beloved son, the Messiah, enjoys an esteemed position as the only begotten Son of God, rejoicing in the presence of his Father. With a unique filial relationship, he is deserving of reverence and honor.

This verse highlights the presence of a beloved son, the Messiah, who holds a significant position as the only begotten Son of God. With a deep filial connection to his Father, he rejoices in His presence and is worthy of reverence.

This passage focuses on the recognition of a beloved son, the Messiah, who is the exclusive and cherished Son of God. Possessing a unique filial relationship with his Father, he delights in His presence and is deserving of profound reverence.

This beloved son mentioned in the text is none other than the Messiah, the one and only Son of God, who enjoys a special filial bond with his Father. Rejoicing in the presence of his Father, he should be esteemed and honored with deep reverence.
